AA.name: Circuit switching
AA.desc: A process that, on demand, connects two or more data terminal equipments and permits the exclusive use of a data circuit between them until the connection is released (ISO).

AB.name: SITA
AB.desc: Communications number assigned by Societe Internationale de Telecommunications Aeronautiques (SITA).

AC.name: ARINC
AC.desc: Communications number assigned by Aeronautical Radio Inc.

AD.name: Courier
AD.desc: A communication channel identifying a courier.

AE.name: Express post
AE.desc: Express (e.g. overnight) postal service document delivery.

CA.name: Cable address
CA.desc: The cable is used as communication medium.

EI.name: EDI transmission
EI.desc: Number identifying the service and service user.

EM.name: Electronic mail
EM.desc: Exchange of mail by electronic means.

FX.name: Telefax
FX.desc: Device used for transmitting and reproducing fixed graphic material (as printing) by means of signals over telephone lines or other electronic transmission media.

GM.name: GEIS (General Electric Information Service) mailbox
GM.desc: GEIS mailbox system is used as communication medium.

IE.name: IBM information exchange
IE.desc: IBM IE is used as communication medium.

PB.name: Postbox no.
PB.desc: Postbox system is used as communication medium.

PS.name: Packet switching
PS.desc: The process of routing and transferring data by means of addressed packets so that a channel is occupied only during the transmission; upon completion of the transmission the channel is made available for the transfer of other packets (ISO).

SW.name: S.W.I.F.T.
SW.desc: Communications address assigned by Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunications s.c.

TX.name: TWX
TX.desc: Communication service involving Teletypewriter machines connected by wire or electronic transmission media. Teletypewriter machines are the devices used to send and receive signals and produce hardcopy from them.
